Context: When compared to wild-type animals, mice lacking SIRT1 catalytic activity rapidly accumulated excessive hepatic lipid while fed the HFD, an effect evident within 2 wk of HFD feeding.

Despite their elevated rates of respiration, we report that these animals developed more severe characteristics of metabolic syndrome than did their wild-type littermates, indicating that the catalytic activity of SIRT1 plays an important role in the acclimation of mice to diets rich in calories, perhaps by influencing the composition of the gut microbiome.
